result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th) and Operating w/ PAC (4th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Joel K Lenz was found guilty of OWI (4th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Joel K Lenz was found guilty of Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

- Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with recommended treatment.
- Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

- Restitution set at $0.
- Pay mandatory costs, fees, and surcharges, including DNA, during term of probation. If revoked, out of prison funds at a rate to be determined by DOC, balance paid during extended supervision.  Failure to pay results in a civil judgment.

- No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription, no illegal drugs and no alcohol
- No further violations of the law.

- AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
- Absolute sobriety, random urine screens.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joel K Lenz

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Joel K Lenz in court with attorney Darryl Everett Smith.  Defendant Joel K Lenz in custody.  Allysa Bria Brown appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

As to Counts 1, 3: Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the criminal complaint and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. 

As to Count 2: Pursuant to negotiations and on State's motion, Court orders charge dismissed by operation of law.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by parties and defendant. 

As to Count 1: Defendant ordered to serve 120 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to Count 3, credit of 57 days time served, Huber privileges for work and treatment, good time credit. 
- Court ordered defendant's driving privileges REVOKED for 24 months.  
- Court ordered Ignition Interlock for a period of 24 months.
- Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with recommended treatment.
- Defendant ordered to pay a fine in the amount of $600.00 plus mandatory costs, penalties and surcharges by 03-24-2024 or a civil judgment will be entered with tax intercept.  Bail on deposit if applicable to be applied.

As to Count 3: The court sentenced the defendant to a maximum term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 3.5 years, consecutive to Count 1, the term of initial confinement is 1.5 years, the term of extended supervision is 2 years. Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on probation for 2 years.

Court finds defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program OR the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

Conditions of Probation/Extended Supervision
- AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
- Absolute sobriety, random urine screens.
- No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription, no illegal drugs and no alcohol
- No further violations of the law.
- Cooperate with agent.
- Restitution set at $0. 
- Pay mandatory costs, fees, and surcharges, including DNA, during term of probation. If revoked, out of prison funds at a rate to be determined by DOC, balance paid during extended supervision.  Failure to pay results in a civil judgment. 

Court ordered defendant's driving privileges revoked for a minimum of 6 months. 

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum

2663 jury instruction

AMENDED Plea forms
Turnover to Justice Point for level 5 supervision. All previously ordered conditions of bail to remain the same.

Defendant Joel K Lenz in court, in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom. Bail motion by defense argued and granted by the Court.  Bail $1,000.00. Defense requests a plea and sentencing date. Case adjourned, Branch 2 room G55 CJF.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 24, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Joel K Lenz in court with Attorney Darryl Everett Smith.  Defendant Joel K Lenz in custody.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: D. Ellis - Greendale Police Officer.   Stipulation to the identification of the defendant agreed upon by the parties and approved by the court.   Court took judicial notice of the defendants prior convictions. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty. Defense to be heard on bail on the next date. Next date scheduled with permission of the clerk in Br. 2. Case is adjourned to Branch 02.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for February 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.
  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY with breathalyzer tests. and SCRAM.
  No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Joel K Lenz in court with attorney Kathryn A Holtz.  Defendant Joel K Lenz in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
